6123fe17fbc6dd7e3564502b00952d7eefb675a1e9263809d993a7a71af5d187,B2,CC,Actor ANDROID advertises Cerberus Android banking bot,"

The Android malware market has been stagnant recently and only a small number of products were available. In April 2019, we reported the actor ((android)) (aka ((Exosales)), ((Exosales2)) ) started selling the Android banking trojan Exobot Compact (see: https://titan.intel471.com/report/fd8a595b1e65876103809c23f60e0390). Another vendor, the actor ((obf)) (aka ((Bestoffer)) ), has been active with the semiprivate Gustuff Android banking trojan (see: https://titan.intel471.com/report/917aa326a8625371067a826d0c5d87c1).
Several actors claimed to be operating or developing private Android
column2: bots. For example, the actor ((trafimer)) allegedly was running an unspecified private product (see: https://titan.intel471.com/report/caca7dab6d51fa78a7db56cefd805271). A former supporter of the Anubis Android bot, the actor ((GEDeON)) (aka ((Gedeon)) ), allegedly planned to start developing a new version of Anubis for private use only. Several actors offered leaked versions of the Anubis Android bot.

column1: Although new malware strains always are in the underground community spotlight, discussion of the Cerberus Android bot was limited thus far. The actor
column3: shared screenshots of the control panel two days before the official sales started,&nbsp
column4: when the actor commented in the actor ((Xrenovi4))&rsquo
column5: s thread and asked about recent trends in the Android malware area. The actor Xrenovi4
column7: provided a positive review of the Cerberus control panel&nbsp

column1: Another forum member, the actor ((ndaloz)), also provided positive feedback about the Cerberus bot and claimed the malware previously was only for private use. The actor
column4: post likely indicates the actor used or tested the bot. The actor&nbsp
column5: ndaloz personally was involved in web hacking and selling access to compromised websites and payment card databases

column1: The Cerberus Android bot control panel roughly resembles the control panel of the Anubis bot and several actors also noticed the similarity. The bot&rsquo
column2: s logo is an image of a three-headed dog and resembles a forum avatar used by the actor ((CC_CERBER)). However, it seems to be a coincidence.

column1: On June 24, 2019, our sensitive and reliable source contacted the actor&nbsp
column4: additional details about the bot, including features, price tags and a list of web-injects. The actor stressed the malware was developed from scratch and previously was available for private use only. &nbsp

column1: 1. According to the actor, the Cerberus Android bot had the following functionality at the time of this report (translated from Russian):

column2: Keylogger (messengers, WatsApp, secret chats on Telegram, banking, etc.
Force closing phishing tabs of the apps (banks and the like)
Push notifications from apps (A custom push notification from any app can be triggered)
Obtaining the list of all the apps that are installed on a device
Prohibiting users from deleting the bot
Prohibiting users from lowering admin privileges
Prohibiting users from disabling Accessibility Services
The option to have several reserve URLs for connecting to the server (They can be dynamically set up in the admin panel)

column3: they will be downloaded to a device and then run from the drive
column4: they will not be affected by bad connection or no connection at all)

column2: Automatically running web injects after the time specified in the admin panel elapses
Automatically disabling Google Play Protect + setting up the timeout for it in the admin panel
Anti-emulator (The bit starts working only after spotting some device activity)

column1: Injects and (Invisible) SMS interception are available in versions 5 to 9
2. The Cerberus Android bot is shipped with the following web-injects (translated from Russian):
This is the list of web-injects we have at this moment:
The following are examples of designed web-injects:

column2: T, Bank of America, Capital One, Discover, Fifth Third Bank, JPMorgan Chase, USAA, US Bank and Wells Fargo.

column3: claimed a client would be able to add custom web-injects developed by third-party services through the JavaScript application programming interface (API) in the control panel.

column1: 3. According to the actor, it is possible to rent the bot for three, six or 12 months and prices range from US $4,000 to US $12,000 (translated from Russian):
We will be selling the three-, six- and 12-month licenses for using the bot. They will cost US $4,000, US $7,000 and US $12,000, respectively.
The license covers free updates and support. The updates also include web-injects, which will be added for other banks whenever necessary.

column3: recently resurfaced on the market, so the malware lacked any extensive reviews at the time of this report. However, the first clients who tested or used the bot provided positive responses. The actor
column5: also gave our source additional details about the product. Therefore, we
column6: assess the information posted by the actor with a Credibility of &ldquo

column2:
Screenshots shared by the actor.

","

On June 23, 2019, the actor ((ANDROID)) posted the following on the XSS

column1: Cerberus - андроид бот, который работал в привате на протяжении последних 2х лет. Сейчас мы решили выйти из привата, для поиска партнёров.
Тесты только на своих девайсах, гарант за ваш счёт.

column3: posted the following on the XSS forum:

column1: Cerberus is an Android bot that has been run privately for the last two years. We'
column2: ve decided to make it known now in order to find partners.

column1: Inquire about its detailed description via PM.
Trials on test devices only. Escrow accepted (at your expense).

[source: https://titan.intel471.com/post_thread/d018d22d3ac7fb0534c8bec7fc4cd982]
